publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6049 Hugh Henry: Scottish Huntington’s Association—That the Parliament notes that Huntington’s disease is a devastating, high-risk, inherited, neurological condition that causes a profound form of dementia and mental ill health; commends the hard work done by the Scottish Huntington’s Association based in Paisley in raising awareness of Huntington’s disease; welcomes the joining together of the Scottish Huntington’s Association and the Huntington’s associations of Ireland, England and Wales and Northern Ireland to work collaboratively to raise awareness of Huntington’s disease, and calls on all MSPs to support the efforts of the Scottish Huntington’s Association to redress the awareness deficit.

S3M-6049 Scottish Huntington’s Association (lodged on 23 March 2010) Liam McArthur*, Jackson Carlaw*, Rhona Brankin*, Cathie Craigie*, Cathy Jamieson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Sandra White*, Mike Pringle*, Ken Macintosh*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Karen Whitefield*, Margaret Curran*, Nanette Milne*, Jackie Baillie*

S3M-6049 Scottish Huntington’s Association (lodged on 23 March 2010) Dr Richard Simpson*, Patricia Ferguson*, Jamie Hepburn*, Helen Eadie*, Robin Harper*, James Kelly*, Trish Godman*, Mary Mulligan*, Stuart McMillan*, Jack McConnell*, Mary Scanlon*

S3M-6049 Hugh Henry: Scottish Huntington’s Association—That the Parliament notes that Huntington’s disease is a devastating, high-risk, inherited, neurological condition that causes a profound form of dementia and mental ill health; commends the hard work done by the Scottish Huntington’s Association based in Paisley in raising awareness of Huntington’s disease; welcomes the joining together of the Scottish Huntington’s Association and the Huntington’s associations of Ireland, England and Wales and Northern Ireland to work collaboratively to raise awareness of Huntington’s disease, and calls on all MSPs to support the efforts of the Scottish Huntington’s Association to redress the awareness deficit. Supported by: Liam McArthur, Jackson Carlaw, Rhona Brankin, Cathie Craigie, Cathy Jamieson, Kenneth Gibson, Sandra White, Mike Pringle, Ken Macintosh, Marilyn Livingstone, Karen Whitefield, Margaret Curran, Nanette Milne, Jackie Baillie, Dr Richard Simpson, Patricia Ferguson, Jamie Hepburn, Helen Eadie, Robin Harper, James Kelly, Trish Godman, Mary Mulligan, Stuart McMillan, Jack McConnell, Mary Scanlon, Elaine Murray*
S3M-6049 Scottish Huntington’s Association (lodged on 23 March 2010) Bill Butler*, Marlyn Glen*
S3M-6049 Scottish Huntington’s Association (lodged on 23 March 2010) Christine Grahame*
S3M-6049 Scottish Huntington’s Association (lodged on 23 March 2010) Rhoda Grant*, Margaret Mitchell*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-6049 Scottish Huntington’s Association (lodged on 23 March 2010) David Stewart*
